Twitter: @tapas_app
Facebook: Tapas
summary: Read webcomics & webnovels

scraped_reviews.content: Good selection, but a bunch of the comics have later episodes locked behind a paywall. That'd be okay, but my gripe is that it isn't clear when the paywall is permanent vs just for the latest releases. I never know if or when a page will be free. I worry about spending money when all I need to spend is patience. I've wasted money this way before and don't want to again. Predictability would improve my experience.

It has good series, but is not friendly to binge readers. Most series you can read one episode per day for free. You can also buy ink to unlock more episodes. Episodes stay unlocked, but unlocking a full series is quite expensive, often ranging from 30-60$, depending on the number of episodes. At that price I would prefer to be buying physical copies. You can play games on other apps to get ink, so there's a work around, but the ones I've tried have been very time-consuming.

Updated: Tapas has gone down. They upped their ink per unlock and made it harder to earn free ink, and earned amounts are still the same compared to the upped prices. Wait Until Free keeps reopening chapters I'd already unlocked previously. For the 3 free ad unlocks, it barely works and often goes to an ad that won't load, and then takes away the rest of the chances. Original: Great stories and comics, and the app has lots of free ink opportunities and prize giveaways for users! Love this app!

There's a good amount of manhwa available here, but that is marred by oftentimes middling translations, a paltry 3 chapters, or even 1 chapter, a day limit per manhwa (unless you spend ink), painful ink prices, and very little in the way of free ink. In addition, it can oftentimes take weeks or months before chapters become available as part of the free chapters a day. While not the worst place to read manhwa, it certainly stumbles quite often.

The app mostly works, however, unlocking episodes with ads doesn't work at all. The whole ad will play, but nothing. Selecting the episode again just comes up with the unlock options again, but only the paid ones. Very frustrating and has cemented the fact that I will not be spending money on this app.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, can you please contact us at feedback@tapas.io, and we will gladly help you in resolving the issue. - Team Tapas

scraped_reviews.content: So does anyone else have an issue where they can't watch videos or complete surveys to get ink? Like the options just suddenly disappeared and when I try to complete offers it never loads. I don't know what is going on. There needs to be improvement with Announcements. I went into my library and saw that several series are no longer available and I never got any notification despite having my notifications on.

This is one of my favorite webcomic apps, but there's been a recent frustration: watching ads to read an episode. More often than not, I have to restart the app several times just to watch an ad because the ads aren't loading on the first, second, OR third try. If the goal is to make people give up on the ad and purchase it out of convenience, you might succeed, and then again, you may frustrate people enough that they find the effort isn't worth the payout.

Im giving this app a 1 star rating because one, it keeps freezing on me. Like, its nearly impossible to navigate. I don't like how when I want to watch an ad to unlock an episode, the ad might play, but then it will glitch and I can't access the chapter. Plus, while I'm reading, the chapter freezes on me and I have to use this up and down arrow thing to move through the chapter. Its extremely annoying.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We are actively working on a solution for this issue and plan to release a fix soon. Thank you for your patience. For any additional questions or concerns, please email us at feedback@tapas.io.

scraped_reviews.content: I am having some troubles. Don't get me wrong, I love this app. The thing is that the wait for free books is annoying me because of the simple fact that it doesn't unlock them permenantly. I wait a day, 2 days, or even a week for 1 chapter but then I would have to unlock it again if i wanted to re-read the chapter. Meaning, i would have to wait again. I know there is a new feature with 3hr wait books but it isn't just those. It's all the wait for free books. Tickets work just fine.

I loved using Tapas, but it looks like they just changed (without any warning to their readers) the way you can unlock and read episodes. Now you not only have to wait for a free episode, you only get the episode for three days. So for anyone who likes to re-read series and episodes this removes the ability. Also, it removes the opportunity to unlock a couple of episodes to read together in a row. I am much less likely to read on tapas, and now I will have to cut down on how many I subscribe to.

Since taps is new. Changes I've been unable to read my books properly. It's getting frustrating to the point where I'm starting to hate the app. No matter how much I like the artwork and the stories, it's not worth the hassle if you can only read. One out of every 7 panels when I sent an email to tabs about the issue. They responded with asking me if I could send a screenshot to show them. What was going on when they know that it's their security policy to prevent That

I've spent a ridiculous amount of money on the premium apps. Tons. I love the stories, can get engrossed for 8 hours in all the ones I read. However, I can't even get them to load anymore. It's been a problem for a while now and it's real frustrating. Would love to give tapas 5 stars, but until the loading issue is fixed, I just can't. Five starts for when I can actually read comics again ‚úå

Bring back the old ad system and stop making this app worst. I do buy ink, fairly often, but I only do so after getting into the series I have used ink I've earned through ads on. This new system makes me want to no longer participate in reading on this app in any capacity. As a reader, as a customer, I feel like this app is pushing me away. I wouldn't even mind the arbitrary price increases if the ad system was still in place. But it isn't, so I do mind.

Great content. Lots to read. Problem is that they keep shorting us pages of comics. A comic that had long pages before are artificialy shortened to milk money. It's super obvious too because the two pages would link to easily with no brake if they were together. Not to mention that a ton of comments keep having likes on them when I've never even been on the page, so lots of fake engagement. This app was worth using even just a year ago, but they keep making it less so. I'll still use it, sadly.

I used to regularly buy ink and read almost all of my favorite manhwas through tapas. However, over the past year or so, chapter prices have increased, events have become extremely difficult to accomplish, with minimal rewards, and free chapters have become a rarity. Rather than increasing my spending to try and keep up with this change, I've chosen to step away. I will read the first few free chapters of a new story on tapas, and continue reading elsewhere now. I miss what this app used to be.

I've loved using this app for a really long time. EXTREMELY FRUSTRATED with their new update! Why is their wait-to-read section moving from unlocked forever to only unlocked for 3 days??? That was one of the things that I really enjoyed about this app! I like to binge read my media and now I'm not going to be able to go back and re-read through a comic. That takes a lot of the enjoyment out of it! And I only ever spend ink when I've hit a streak in my reading and I really want to keep going!

Edit to add: The ads are so broken now. You can't mute them, you can't close them, and sometimes they won't play so you have to close the app and restart to get back to where you were. Since I had to do an edit on an already poor review, I'm dropping another star. Would be nice if it worked. I've had to uninstall and reinstall more than once and my place in the comics aren't being saved. But most of the time things simply won't load. It used to be a great app.

I love the COMICS on this app a considerable amount, but the app itself just keeps going downhill. First they take away the ability to watch ads for ink (which had me watching up to 30 ads a day, a feat which no other app was able to accomplish) and replaced it with an ad unlock that only worked on certain titles. Then they took THAT away, too! Now you can only unlock episodes that you were gonna get for free anyway, defeating the purpose. Not to mention the ads just kept getting buggier...

Reads, but: No option to jump to a particular chapter (other than last opened) in list of 1000. Can't find button to turn off 1-tap after turning it on. FAQ states bulk purchases are available during sales, but I am still forced to unlock one by one during current sale. It seems to be designed to prevent taking full advantage of sales. A terrible experience, and leads me to believe the company does not have readers' best interests in mind, if not outright misleading and exploitative.

Constantly shoves other comics and offers and deals in your face every time you open the app. It sometimes takes closing two or three popups before you can get to what you actually came there for. There are constantly new "offers" in your inbox which is just whatever comic they want you reading (often not even free!) Or whatever ads they got paid to show you. It's a horrible app, I wish I had a better way to just read the comics without a random unrelated thing getting shoved at me.

Used to enjoy this app, but now it just doesn't function. I'll get a notification of a new comic update, but upon clicking that, I get an error & the comics won't load. Like a timeout error perhaps? The comic will then be removed from "recently updated" so I have to manually navigate to the comic page; but even that returns the error out 75% of the time. I can't follow my comics anymore because of this. Disappointing.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi! Please restart your device and also clear the cache for the app. If that doesn‚Äôt help, please contact us at feedback@tapas.io. Thank you for your patience!

scraped_reviews.content: Great. Would be awesome if a dark theme is added for the entire app, seeing as the everything in the app is white and not preferable when sitting in the dark. Another issue is the ink price of the premium comics, it's just straight up too much, you would have to pay a lot of money just to unlock an entire series. I get that the ink supports the creators but I feel that if it was cheaper then the creators would get more people following them, which would make up for the price.

It would be great if you could view your subbed list with more options. For instance, I've been wanting to be able to sort by/view only premium or non-premium options for a long time. It would make it easier to find titles of things I don't remember the names of but remember which category it's in. And speaking of categories, it would be amazing if we could look for new comics by choosing more than one category. If comics can be listed under more than one category, why can't we search likewise?

It's a nice app with some really good comics, To bad you're limited by half the comics becuase of ink. Without paying for it, it's so hard to earn ink. The ways to earn free ink barely ever work. But I mean it's okay, I do recommend it to people looking to publish comics who have a tight schedule, the updates aren't as long as Webtoons. And it's got a way to pay artist for their efforts so I can always appreciate that. If they just fixed the issues with earing ink then this app would be 10/10

The loading in the webtoons is horrible. I could be using wifi or my own internet, and I still have issues. I've been stuck on a new comic for 7 hours because after a certain chapter, it's not loading. All you see is nothing but a black background with the logo like some cheesy wallpaper. At least you can download comics and read them, right? No. It takes triple the amount of time to download a chapter. I can stream a show on my phone faster than I can read or download a chapter on this app

Using ads to view chapters doesnt seem to work half the time. bulk purchasing chapters is nice, but it's the discount normal fast pass used to have, and doesnt account for being caught up with a series. That's helping me to cut down how many webtoons I read, I suppose, though... Latest update seems to have taken away the ad option instead of fixing it. Already was pretty limited with three global "watch ad to read" per day. I love webtoon's model so much more but Tapas has some good exclusives

The app seriously still needs a lot of work with how often it glitches out. Previously, it wouldn't let me buy an episode, constantly taking me to the refill page even though I had more than enough "ink" to buy the episode I wanted. And now the app is constantly crashing to the point where now I just read episodes on a mobile browser or on a PC. I even went the extra set of Uninstalling and reinstalling the app over and over again. Ughhh. üò´

Like many others, the wait until free change is very frustrating. But even if I give grace to them having a timer for how long a chapter is accessible, the UI is terrible. Not only is it hard to tell what you spent your wuf on, but you can't even purchase WUF episodes normally. Like, I'm willing to just ..buy the chapter. And I can't. I basically only use tappytoon now which is a shame since I preferred tapas and literally have thousands of credits there

I've been using this app for over 10 years, but it's gotten ridiculous with how much it costs to read an entire story (it costs more $ than a book), you can't earn enough free ink to do it, & the ads to get free episodes don't apply for every story, and for the ones they do, they rarely actually work, causing them to be a waste of time & energy. The ad problem has been going on for months now & there still hasn't been a fix, like come on, it shouldn't take this long.

The stories tend to be good, but the problem is the cost. Especially since Tapas has seen fit to basically punish people with staying up-to-date by making it more expensive. You're very limited on using ads, the in-app currency isn't cheap, and now it doesn't go as far as it once did--all without a straight-forward notice about price increases. Probably going to slowly stop using this app and consolidate to something more budget friendly.

Comics are still good and that is the only reason I am giving 3 stars. The app seems to have a lot of bugs and gets worse with every update. It crashes every time I open a new chapter, you can't see the free ink options most of the time, I don't always get my rewards for the games I play, and I can't submit a support ticket on my usual browser (Brave).

When your coming from something like Webtoon where all you had to do is wait longer for new chapters, being forced to use a big amount of ink for literally everything is very annoying. Yes there are some stories that don't require ink, but the majority do. Although if your willing to sit down and binge on other things to get that ink most of the comics on the app are very good and really well made. My favorite was "Daughter of the Emperor", so I'd check that one out.

I love the comments and comment section. This is the reason I'm still on the app. The selection is pretty good too. However, recent changes are making this a pay-only. Wait-for-free is 24hrs at best for most series and is only a 72hr unlock, rather than 'own' like it was 3 years ago. Most events cannot be completed w/o spending real money and the "rewards" don't even recover the losses. The weekly free ink, is randomly generated and 9/10 times is less than the cost of a chapter.

Been using this app for a while and did enjoy a lot of the WUF admittedly but now it doesn't even seem worth it now that the WUF unlocked episodes not only have a timer (which is fine) now after unlocking said episode they are only open for 72hrs. Which doesn't seem bad at first until you realize that the timers differ from series to series. Some are one day all the way up to a week which with the 72 hr system doesn't help at all. Especially when you want to check what happened last episode.

I love the comics on here, but Ink (the currency used to purchase chapters) is arguably on the expensive side and I've been having loading problems where I can't open any of my comics, even though I have the Ink for it. It always comes up with an error saying that it is unavailable even though the chapter has been released. Before turning my phone off and back on resolved the issue (annoying, but I need to do it sometimes anyway), but now that won't even fix the problem.

Very terrible customer support if you ever have an issue. Sink days of your time to complete offers only to not have them rewarded. Then you have to submit a ticket. Despite submitting multiple screenshots and pointing out multiple rewards need to be rewarded, I'm told they can only resolve one issue at a time. So you submit another ticket. It takes WEEKS for them to send an automated response. Then they tell you "you didn't complete the offer in time". 90k ink. What a waste of time.

There's nothing bad about this app (so far?) But you are required to spend some money if you want to read certain books/comics faster. Overall I loved this app and it's useful with lots of novels to read. One thing I'd like to comment on is how I couldn't load any of the pages when I was reading webtoons there (for the first time). I could now tho (after reinstalling it).

Lowering to a 2 star. In addition to the increased amount of wait 3 hours until free turning into wait 24 hours until free, prices keep going up. It's becoming too expensive to keep up with weekly releasing comics, with chapters increasing from 360 ink to 405 ink (it adds up when you have 10-20 comics you read at release weekly). Keep in mind, at the beginning of this year, each chapter was only 300 ink, so it's not the first price increase this year. Dissapointed. Used to be a 5 star app :(

I would love to give this app a five star review, I really would but the 24hr wait until frees on almost every single new release is killing me. It's getting more and more difficult to obtain ink and there needs to be more "watch an ad to unlock an episode for free". At this point, it just feels like a cash grab and I'm not willing to spend $20+ to unlock a full, singular comic/manga. I also don't like how the "wait until free"s have a time limit on them before they become locked again.

If a story gets delisted you are out of luck. Doesn't matter if you paid for it or not, it gets permanently removed from the platform and your library. It makes me not want to use the platform because what if a story I like gets removed? I don't mind spending money but if there is a risk of my purchase becoming worthless then I'm less likely to do it again. At least just let it remain accessible to the people that paid for it and inaccessible to those that didn't like steam or something.

This was a great app until a few months ago when they decided to raise prices and then just keep raising prices without letting readers know. It has gotten ridiculously expensive. I have had to cut way back on how many series I read, because those prices are absurd. Until they raised prices this was my favorite web comic app. Ever since they did the update and simultaneously began raising prices it has been going downhill. The comic quality is top tier, but the app was better before the update.

They took out the fun out of reading stories when there's limitations to your free reads. Accumulating free points is pretty impossible now. Reading should be on everyone's term, as we all live a busy lifestyle. But to them, most reads you try to accumulate for free points expire so quickly. I don't wanna be suckered to spending my time in this app. I want to enjoy my readings whenever I want. Reading should be in someone's pace...so this app will be uninstalled for the time being.

Until recently I've been using this to get some pretty interesting comics read. Their what until free model, while irritating, wasmanageable. Especially since you could just unlock a bunch of comics over time, and then just binge them all. Then all of a sudden I find out that the wait until free model for several comics is no longer a permanent unlock but a temporary one. So now if I unlock a comic with wait until free, I only get it for 3 days. This update is predatory and disingenuous.

Much like other people have said, the app has gone downhill. If I remember correctly I initially joined Tapas around 2011/12 so I've seen plenty of ups & downs. But recently it has been nothing but let downs. The app is glitchy as all get out, it's now usually impossible to actually access the offerwall to earn ink, sometimes your "WUF" disappear the second the comic page loads, just all kinds of of things that feel like they're intentionally trying to force you to spend money. Just pirate üôÑ

Content is great, if not a bit limited, and isn't as strict in their guidelines of what's acceptable. However the pay to read is outrageous. It's difficult to get enough free ink, like taking several hours of watching ads kind of difficult, to read even one chapter forcing you to pay in order to read anything and their wait to read selection is extremely limited.

I'm not sure what happened in the last couple days, but the app on MULTIPLE devices (including when I'm not even signed in so it's not the account) now takes forever to load, and when you click on a comic or novel it will no longer load and just shows an error. It's now useless. I noticed this issue while migrating to a new phone. This app has just gotten worse and worse once they were bought - first the prices were jacked up but then their tech glitches became horrible.

Yeah lowering my review rating as well. The comics on this app are just getting too expensive, Tapas didn't even announce the price increase and just went ahead with it, and there are WAY cheaper options among the comic apps. I'm all for supporting the actual authors, but I've got bills to pay (and I highly doubt this increased cost is actually going towards the authors anyway).

To be honest, I really love this app. I learned that this app existed when I was reading comics on Webtoon, BL not to long ago. But something I'm concerned about is the tokens, and how much just one episode is, it really bugs me. But out of all it's going great! Oh and Please make this app for readable so the readers can freely read as much as they want, oh and tone down the tokens for episodes please! Some readers can't get the tokens and want to keep reading the comic/novel they were reading.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi! Thank you for taking the time to leave your thoughtful feedback!

scraped_reviews.content: Some really good comics and manga/manhwa on this app. Quality is awesome and it's cool that even indie creators can get a foot in the door. It's all marred by the Ink and WUF system. It's dumb (and clearly an attempt at a cash-grab) that I get to read a chapter once a day in a series I like just to use Ink to unlock more of it. Ink that is only available via purchasing it or... reading something I don't care about. Maybe put the art before the money?

I truly like this app. I love we theres sales in the shop so I can stock up on ink during those if I can. Due to the price of each episode (300 ink for 1 tap) I only read a certain amount of comics that I really like, I dont mind if its supporting the authors legally. Would like if they added the option where we could buy a group of episodes at once. Tapas is one of the two webcomic apps that are worthy of my money because of their comic selection. Hope they keep up the good work.

title: Amazon Shopping
description:
Product Features

Amazon Shopping offers app-only benefits to help make shopping on Amazon faster and easier than shopping on your desktop.

Never miss a delivery

Get real-time tracking and delivery notifications so you know where your package is and when it arrives.

Know exactly what you‚Äôre purchasing

Full 360¬∞ product view lets you see items from every angle. ‚ÄúView in you room‚Äù makes sure it fits by using your phone‚Äôs camera and VR so you can see it in your space.

We‚Äôll notify you when items go on sale

Just tap the heart icon to save items to Your Lists and we‚Äôll alert you of price drops so you don‚Äôt miss a deal.

Never forget your password

Save time by staying securely signed in. If you prefer to sign out, use facial or fingerprint identification to sign back in.

Connect with us when it works best for you

Live chat support is open 24 hours, 7 days a week. Once you‚Äôve started a chat, it stays that way for 24 hours so you don‚Äôt have to start your support session from the beginning.

We‚Äôll find that item for you

Not sure of an item‚Äôs brand or where to buy it? Just tap the scan icon in the search bar, take a picture of the item or its barcode, and we‚Äôll find it for you.

Product Description

Browse, search, view product details, read reviews, and purchase millions of products. We deliver to 100+ countries in as quickly as 3-5 days. Whether you‚Äôre buying gifts, reading reviews, tracking orders, scanning products, or just shopping, Amazon Shopping app offers more benefits than shopping on Amazon via your desktop.

Important Note Regarding Permissions

Please note that the Amazon Shopping app requires access to the following services to operate properly: * Contacts: Allows you to send Amazon gift cards to your contacts or invitation to install the Amazon app. * Camera: Allows the Amazon app to access your camera on the device. You can use your camera to find products by scanning the cover or its barcode, to add gift cards and credit cards, or to add pictures in the product reviews. * Flashlight: Allows the Amazon app to turn on the flashlight. You can use the flashlight to find products with the camera feature even in low-light or dark conditions. * Microphone: Allows the Amazon app to access your microphone to use your voice to search and interact with your Assistant. * Location: Allows the Amazon app to access your location to help you discover local offers and select addresses fast. * Account: Allows you to share products on Amazon with your friends and families through Facebook or other social networks. * Phone: Allows the Amazon app to pre-populate the Amazon Customer Service number on your phone‚Äôs keypad. * Storage: Allows the Amazon app to store your preferences so that some features can load and run faster on the device. * Wi-Fi: This permissions is used when setting up either a Dash Button or Dash Wand using the Amazon Shopping app. The Amazon App for Tablets is available on Google Play. Search for "Amazon Tablet" to install the app and begin shopping. For customers located within the European Union, United Kingdom, Brazil, or Turkey: By using this app, you agree to Amazon‚Äôs Conditions of Use applicable for your country. Please also see the applicable Privacy Notice, Cookies Notice and Interest-Based Ads Notice for your country. Links to these terms and notices can be found in the footer of your local Amazon homepage. For all other customers: By using this app, you agree to the applicable Amazon Conditions of Use (e.g. www.amazon.com/conditionsofuse) and Privacy Notice (e.g. www.amazon.com/privacy) for your country. Links to these terms and notices can be found in the footer of your local Amazon homepage.

summary: Browse, search & buy millions of products right from your Android device.

scraped_reviews.content: At one point in my life, this app was very good. it's horrendous now. the top results are all sponsored and prioritize irrelevant items, the expected delivery times are rarely ever correct. I can generally expect every item I order to show up a day or two late, minimum, and often more than that. If they have an accurate expected delivery time, I could plan around it, but I frequently miss items when I needed them to the point that I have started ordering from Walmart of all places for accuracy

The last two months, Amazon has been messing up orders left & right. Not sure what's going on, but they owe me some money for sending incorrect items in multiple orders. App design makes customer service on these issues ridiculously hard to find. All dealings with specific orders should be available on the same page for orders/reviews. It was a great shopping app until May 2025.

I absolutely hate this app! Out of the apps I have on my phone, this is the only app that freezes my phone, kicks me off the internet, constantly freezes while browsing, doesn't allow me to tap on any of the selections when searching for items without freezing, and takes a million years to open whatever it is I tap on to open and view. My phone and apps are always up-to-date, so WHAT is the issue?!

Can't access our orders for tracking anymore since the recent change. I do a search for my orders and it shows me shipping suggestions. I used to use the app primarily for keeping track of my orders because the web site makes it difficult to tell what's arriving on a particular day and the app used to sort them by the day expected. This was easy, user friendly, and wonderful. Now it's gone. I have no reason to use the app anymore. I can't easily track any packages anymore.

This new update is a disaster. Nothing in my wishlist is in order, and there's no way to filter it for most recent items. Search brings up items totally unrelated to the keywords. Not to mention that nearly all orders that have been transferred to USPS disappear and get lost. I live a few miles from a distribution center. There's no reason to transfer them to the post office. Been a member for over 10 years. Disappointed with how things have turned out these last few years.

Look, Amazon is Amazon and it's app isn't all that different from it's website from a mobile standpoint. But now they're putting ads into your notification bar. They could section off "deals picked for you" notifs and "delivery update" notifs, but they don't. Lumping these two kinds of notifications together without an option to toggle them is ignorant at best and manipulative at worst. I just need quick delivery updates, nothing else, and I don't need an app that can't or won't do just that.

Terrible search algorithm: The app is almost unusable. I have tried and tried to use this site but as the years pass, the search becomes less and less capable. Even 15 years ago I could still use the filters as such. When I searched for an item today, the display photos were massive. Only one item is shown on the screen now. Not only can I not find the correct items, the wrong items take up the whole screen. My eyesight has not changed, nor has my ability to spell or know what I want to buy.

Amazon has refused to address problems I first brought up years ago, and now they seem to WANT to be impossible to use. Between facing a disabled "continue" button at the payment options screen when paying with gift cards, not being able to buy Amazon gift cards anymore, having Visa cards repeatedly declined without explanation, and useless customer service, I've had my last straw. They've lost me as a customer and I'm deleting my account. This slow, janky app with no offline isn't any better.

The Amazon app can be frustrating, especially during Prime Day and Black Friday, where pricing feels deceptive. Items are often marked up before being ‚Äúdiscounted‚Äù making it seem like you‚Äôre getting a deal when you‚Äôre not. Cancelling Prime if you don't want it anymore is a hassle and customer support can be hit or miss. If you have an issue with an order sometimes you get the runaround or are told you‚Äôve been refunded, only to find out you haven't forcing you to go through the process again.

I've been using this app for years and it's solid, but if there's an issue with your order, Amazon is real persnickety and bull-headed about issuing a refund. Suddenly because the item wasn't "sold AND shipped" by Amazon, you the customer have to wait 48 hours or until the seller contacts you about a resolution. Even if you don't want the item anymore, they'll tell you to "contact the seller" and make it a spectacle that they can keep themselves out of unless the seller escalates the issue.

Until today, I have never had any problems with the app. However, today I can't choose options on an item. For example I select an item that can come in different colors. While the button is there showing the current color and a down arrow to select another, tapping it does nothing. I had no problems yesterday, and it just started today. I checked for updates, and I updated. I cleared cache. I force stopped the app. Nothing has corrected the issue. If it corrects itself, I will edit this review.

Has a lot of options, some cheap, others price gouged and clearly coming from drop shippers. They also recently got rid of the ability to organize your lists by moving the items around to be in the order you want them to be, and this was never available to mobile in the first place for some reason. Enshittification hitting Amazon hard.

You have to click through like 5 different pages before you have the option to even speak to customer service. Nothing qualifies for return/replacement or refund. What's worse, Amazon moderates all the reviews, so you can't even warn others about anything. UPDATE: they've incorporated that stupid AI assistant bs, which will pop up with "suggested questions" every time you click on an item. And 80% of the time, it refuses to go away, making a part of your screen unusable. Utterly infuriating.

Getting really sick and tired of paying for same day shipping or expecting an order by a certain date and then I'm told AFTER the order is already late that it will be late. Amazon is NOT reliable. I'm about to cancel my subscription and go back to in store shopping. Ridiculous. Please keep taking my money and not holding up your end. Infuriating.

App can be frustrating. After receiving push notifications concerning items in my lists, then tapping the notification, the app launches to a cute little dog with "oops something went wrong on our end". Come on Amazon developers, this happens all the time and has for months. How about fixing the links you push to your customers? I think you have the resources to fix it. In addition, there's absolutely no way to send bug reports directly to Amazon, they sure love me to send them my money though.

Every time there is an update it just takes longer to navigate.. Now there is a product preview pop up... Can we just go to the product we click on and see all the details? Why the extra step? ... Also, now you've got a button to just add stuff to my order that is in progress where the add to cart should be so I keep adding stuff to my order on accident...then have to cancel.. At least put both options... On the plus side the check boxes in the cart were a great idea! Lol

Deceptive "add to delivery" button. It is too easy to accidentally order things while scrolling, and the only notification is a tiny pop-up that is easy to miss. This "feature" needs an opt out option, or at least a better verification system (like an actual confirmation button). As is, it seems designed to solicit mistaken, unconfirmed purchases to make more money. There is such a thing as "too convenient", and this feature has crossed that line. I accidentally placed 6 orders.

New update might fix my shopping addiction. It's beyond annoying at best. The pop up? Won't even give you an option to "see all details" on some products. Several items don't even show the product photo that is right there before you click on it. Also, the whole pop up thing is not enough to see anything important of what you clicked on and just big enough to be in the way of you seeing anything else you may want to. Going to a store is more convenient and less frustrating now.

I love this app; it is an absolute godsend for me! I greatly appreciate the large variety of products offered too. One gripe: Why won't the subscriptions ship on the dates I set them for? It doesn't matter what I do; it does its own thing. Where did the comparison option in the cart go? In fact, it would be great to have that tool elsewhere, not just in the cart. Lastly, if I could change one thing, it would be the lists; I'd make it easier to edit the list and/or items in it.

As a consumer, I ran into more problems attempting to make a purchase through Amazon than necessary. I had a specific amount of money set aside which was there for my items. Now since Amazon wont take the money when you actually "purchase" what you freaking want it left my money vulnerable. By the time my order was supposed to come, the phone company took my money ( LinkedIn, Apple, and T-Mobile) all tried to make a grab at the money) so I locked it, and now I have to wait till the next day?

Can't return via the app anymore. You're forced into an "AI" chat that won't open the keyboard, so the process just slams to a halt. This latest "unintentional" bug is another reason I'm using Amazon less and less. The company isn't replacing people with AI, which they KNOW doesn't work. It's using AI as an excuse to fire workers without taking a stock hit. Customer service is no longer offered by Amazon. The pop-ups would fail a UX class. They increase order mistakes, probably intentionally.

I'm a long-time customer(10+ years) who's had a few issues with the company in general. Firstly, the "buy" option for movies on Prime is not a purchase it's a long-term rental as long as you keep paying monthly for Prime. Secondly, if I wanted to wait weeks for items, I'd use Temu, I want to buy American. Thirdly, the company as a whole doesn't care about us(customers). I'm done paying for Prime "benefits", they're not benefits anymore and I'll be losing $800 in movie purchases alone.

Normally just fine amazon but WHY are you throwing out "add to next delivery" instead of add to cart suddenly?? And you do realize if you're scrolling looking for something you'll immediately click out of that "undo" option. You just charged my card without my okay, and almost got me for another one. "Add to delivery" SHOULD NOT be an option while you're scrolling unless you want it to be!

Good shopping app, but would like to see a settings menu. I dont like Rufus popping up at the bottom and in my way when trying to look at a product. And now when I click on an item it's only giving a small pop up and I have to click another button "see detail" to fully get into the item. So I have to click 2x to look at a product and Rufus is in my way to look at it!? please change or give me the option to change

Lately it's been crashing or freezing alot. Very slow running. Update 11/11/25, again its not playing review videos trying to watch, lag time on typing for results to come up, have to close app and re-open, this has been going on for weeks, but decided to see if maybe i needed an update just now, but nope nothing to update these fixes. For the most used app in the world you'd think it wouldn't have so many issues like this. My rating is for the app itself as I have no issues with orders at all.

My deliveries aren't coming on time and the orders aren't always correct. I am not able to process returns on some items, the reason for a returns are often due to bad shipping and storage. Amazon doesn't seem to care. I order a $300 item and got a different $19 item and they kept hanging up on me and I couldn't process a return with the higher tier return department. Now Amazon is trying to control the reviews, they are trying to stop you from seeing and clicking the helpful icon on bad revs.

In the Amazon, "Push Noticfication" means ads! This app can send you a Push Notification everytime they take a nickel off fart cream, but god forbid it be used to tell you something is wrong with your order or payment in a timely manner. No, that kind of information is email only. Now if they could send the right stuff. üôÑ Also, maybe if I order something in one order don't make me fix the payment several times because you dumb animals split the order into several shopping dates.

I love the app and spend a ridiculous amount of money a month on Amazon but the new brief overview instead of popping up the full page absolutely sucks. You have to find the "view full details" button before it brings you to the product page. It's an unnecessary step that is very annoying, I'll definitely start find alternative shopping places as you cannot turn this option off.

I had no issues with Amazon until now. I paid $750 for a GPU over a week ago after paying for faster shipping. when I finally got in touch with customer service after 3 days of asking, I was told my package was stuck in the warehouse because of a "mis scan". absolutely unbelievable. When I'm paying for a prime membership and faster shipping on top of that, I fully expect emails and communication as to why my package hasn't shipped yet. even more so when I spend that much money.

do away with the quick view on items clicked. If I click the item I WANTED PRODUCT DETAILS AND REVIEWS. How in TF will I get that from a quick view??? why do I have to click TWICE just to see the product in full?? Edit: so not only do you have to finagle the system to get through do you give feedback through chat.. it seems like they don't even know what's going on so they want to call you about it, it's your system you should know what it's doing.

(9/12/25)I order certain items because it says they'll arrive at a certain time wich is when I need them and Amazon likes to keep changing the delivery date after I make the purchase...(11/8/25)to this day they are still falsely advertising their delivery dates and times...stuff i says ill receive today will come in 2 days. why say you can delivey at a certain time if you can't. just be honest for once! terrible service!

I pay for Amazon Prime, which also includes SAME DAY or even Next day delivery, yet my packages are always arriving later. I am tired of these processing delays at your damn facilities!! Deliver on time or refund your customers for your delaying of packages! I am tired of it being expected to arrive one day, but arrives later instead.. otherwise, it is a decent app where you can find almost anything.

The Amazon shopping app continues to get worse and worse. FIRST: the Rufus (Doofus) pop-up is an aggravation, it's okay to have as an option but is in the way most of the time- remember we are shopping on a cellphone screen. SECOND: since the most recent update when you press on an item it opens the miniature box with little or no descriptive information and you have to press again to get to the full item's page. Is your goal to sell products or to exercise your customers fingers pressing links?

I've never ordered something and not had an issue. Every time I order something a problem comes up. Delivered to wrong address, lost in transit... etc. Currently they have lost my product. Made it to local distribution facility in one day but has been there lost there for several days. And if I choose refund it'll take several days for me to actually receive the refund. Never received product. Day 7 since I requested a refund. Day 11 and I guess I've just been robbed!

I have had prime for years. It's not worth it. what's the point in paying for prime when most of your same day, two day packaging don't come on time. also regular packaging don't come on day it says it's going to come. prime member should get some type of credit or money back. The hold point of ordering something within a certain time frame is because we need it by then. or have an special occasions etc. and it doesn't come on time. Even if it's a day. I hate it takes a while to take the money

I've never reviewed the Amazon app before but after the last update I absolutely had to because I hate, HATE the new "feature" when you select a listing and it brings up a stupid preview window for the item I want to look at that lacks ANY of the useful information like the description or reviews. I have to now hit a SECOND button ("See all details") to view the actual product... Doesn't even make sense because most of the info you get from the new preview you get from the listing itself.

I Hate the way they've changed things on this app. I was trying to order 1 thing to be shipped to my daughter for her birthday. The STUPID app kept adding the item to another order, 5 times! All the orders better get canceled! I only need 1 item to ship to my daughter, NOT to me with another order! NOT ordering another item for a gift until I KNOW that all of those multiple duplicates are canceled!

Latest update lags a lot and tends to give left field results. Pictures don't upload, the cart won't update. just buggy in general. Per Amazon orders, I've recieved strange generic looking packages in place of commercial product, and have experienced horribly packed orders. Maybe bring back the human aspect. Speaking of humans, customer service, though vexingly scripted, is acceptable.

The new product preview is killing me. When I tap a product I don't want to see a preview that requires a second tap to get to the full page like normal. I want to go straight to the product page like I always have. This is inconvenient and makes me not want to shop Amazon anymore, which is fine because I have WalMart+ also. At least give people the option to disable it

The buy now is larger and an obnoxious orange. if you have any eye issue it can make it harder and more difficult to focus on the rest of the page. the new app keeps getting worse. when I click the item I want to see all the details. I should not have to click another button on a slightly larger veiw on my screen. Amazon is really starting to become less appealing to shop with. Add the lack of customer service, customer care, and consideration to get your product to you undamaged.

there is something that has broken the app completely I cannot order things I need like my sleep apnea mask. is there any user-friendly and it's really hard to navigate especially when Your wishlist. when trying to purchase something it's hard to find it from time to time especially amongst all the trash that's being shoved on your throat. I'm trying to repurchase something that you purchase before it's a little bit hard to navigate especially when it's been a few months since then.

This last update I lost everything! All my recent purchases and I have a few things I need to return and only a few days left to do it. Everything in my cart. My save for later stuff that I just went into the app to purchase some of the items. All those hours searching for this stuff just gone. Im partially paralyzed so looking for clothes that are easy to put on, stuff to actually help me cook for my young son. I'm ready to delete you Amazon and just find another platform.

I feel because of how large Amazon is now, they dont care about individual shoppers experience. Im sure others have noticed how difficult it is to get support from a person now, if you're able to do so at all. wouldn't be a problem if I was able to get the issue resolved, and I cant request a chat or phone call anymore either, I tried calling them and the wait time was 1 hr. they've officially made it more trouble than its worth to shop with them, so for me it's time to shop elsewhere. ‚úåÔ∏è&ü´∂

Im pretty sure out of the hundreds of orders I've made off amazon, maybe 6 or 7 haven't been a problem. My packages are always a week or more late. The orders keep messing up and separating themselves, so I end up paying tax 3 different times instead of 1.Every time I try to make a dispute,I get put on hold ,then they hang up. It takes days to get your money back (if you even get it back at all). Customer service is terrible. I can go on... if you want to stress 90% of the time go with amazon...

I have a terrible time with this company. They have lied to me several times about shipping information. I am giving them a one-star rating because one of my last orders, that did not reach me. Amazon told me that I received my order more than 30 days before my last shipping update, which had been continually moved forward by 5 days or more each week. I believe that means somebody committed fraud by changing the tracking information after the fact. I contacted customer service about this issue!

Ship dates frequently lie, if you look at an item it will say "Arrives tomorrow if ordered in the next 1hr 56min." but then you add it to your cart and it suddenly changes to two days from now. go back to the item listing and it still says it'll arrive by tomorrow. all the "deals" are fake, most items are scams and knockoffs, and everything is sponsored so Amazon makes money while you can't even find what you're looking for. Also, Google is definitely lying about the apps 4.4 star rating.

They changed clicking on an item to show a preview instead of the full details. This slows me down immensely, as I need to fully review an item before I consider adding it to my cart. At the very least make this a setting I can change. It is very frustrating to have to click through items twice just to get to all the information...

It's completely broken. It will not load anything account related. Cleared cache, cleared data, even uninstalled and reinstalled. Even though I tap the button to use the account other Amazon apps are using, it still says "Sign in for the best experience", but when I try to sign in, after entering my email address, it just says that I need to enable cookies and try again. Completely unusable at the moment.

New feature does a simple product pop up instead of actually opening the item. It makes you click twice to go into the product and it's incredibly annoying. please revert back to the old style. ALSO, they need better filters for items. If I select only cotton material, more than half of my results, if not most of them, still contain polyester. It's a horrible filter that does not work. Update it.

Amazon just made the dumbest move. Without notice, if you place an order & go shopping for new products afterwards to load up your cart, Amazon added a new blue button on product pages that reads Add To Your Order which requires NO CONFIRMATION if you click it by accident. Normally you get Add To Cart or Buy It Now options. They moved Add To Cart with Add To Order! More importantly why not require a confirmation if someone clicks it?! I was just met with the surprise of 10x rando items charged.

title: Six Pack in 30 Days
description: Want to lose belly fat and get six pack abs for the summer? Start sculpting your abs with this super effective abs workout & body builder app. Workouts are suitable for all levels, and you can easily do them at home or anywhere, anytime. With various Android body builder app features, just a few minutes a day to get the abs you have been dreaming of! üí™ Workout Plan with Different Levels Lose Belly Fat, Rock Hard Abs and Six Pack Abs - these 3 levels of workout plans help you lose belly fat and build abdominal muscles step by step. Whether you are a beginner or a pro, you can find workouts that are suitable for you in our body builder app. From 30-day ab challenge to sport-specific ab training, enjoy different exercises every day to keep it fresh and exciting! üèÜ 30 Days of Workout Routines Amazing results will be achieved earlier once you set a clear goal. 6 Pack Abs - Abs Workout helps you set exercise goals by providing systematic and scientific 30-day workout routines. The exercises can help you burn belly fat as well as tone your abs for better shape and sport stability. Exercise intensity increases gradually, so you can easily make exercising a daily habit. üè† Your Personal Trainer at Home Is hiring a personal trainer too expensive? Have no time to go to the gym? 6 Pack Abs - Abs Workout is your personal trainer at home. Based on the high-intensity circuit training principle, this body builder app ensures these workouts are as effective as gym workouts. üé• Animations and Video Guides 6 Pack Abs - Abs Workout has been scientifically proven to help strengthen all your abdominal muscles. With animations and video guides, you can make sure you perform each exercise safely and effectively and improve sport performance. ‚≠ê Amazing Body Builder App Features - 30-day workout routines for six pack abs, a stronger body and rock-solid sports stability - Amazing sport and fitness abs training for weight management and muscle building - Exercise intensity increases step by step - Customize¬†your¬†workout¬†reminders - Records¬†training¬†progress¬†automatically - Suitable for everyone, beginners, pro, men, women, teens and seniors üè° Workout at Home Take a few minutes a day to get six pack abs with our workout at home. No equipment needed, just use your bodyweight to workout at home. üî• Belly Fat Burning This app has belly fat burning workouts, core workout, lose belly fat workout. These belly fat burning workouts, sport performance core workout, lose belly fat workout proved to help build abdominal muscles. Sweat with our core workout and lose belly fat workout! üëåHome Workout No Equipment You can use this home workout body builder app anywhere, because all of these home workout no equipment needed. üòé Home Workouts for Men Want effective home workouts for men? We provide different home workouts for men. The home workout for men is proven to help you get six pack abs in a short time. You'll find the home workout for men that most suitable for you. Try our home workout for men now! üí¶ Fat Burning Workouts & Hiit Workouts The best fat burning workouts & hiit workouts for better body shape. Burn calories with fat burning workouts, and combine with hiit workouts to get the best results for fitness and sport. üóì Fitness Coach All workouts are designed by professional fitness coach. Workout guide through the exercise, just like having a personal fitness coach in your pocket!

Start sculpting your abs with this super effective abs workout & body builder app. Workouts are suitable for all levels, and you can easily do them at home or anywhere, anytime. With various Android body builder app features, just a few minutes a day to get the abs you have been dreaming of!

üí™ Workout Plan with Different Levels
Lose Belly Fat, Rock Hard Abs and Six Pack Abs - these 3 levels of workout plans help you lose belly fat and build abdominal muscles step by step. Whether you are a beginner or a pro, you can find workouts that are suitable for you in our body builder app. From 30-day ab challenge to sport-specific ab training, enjoy different exercises every day to keep it fresh and exciting!

üèÜ 30 Days of Workout Routines

üè† Your Personal Trainer at Home
